nettrackercore.core package#

Submodules#

nettrackercore.core.controller module#

class nettrackercore.core.controller.NettrackerDAO(json_data: JSONResult | None = None)[source]#

Bases: object

The NettrackerDAO object corresponds to the data access object, more commonly known as DAO. This object is responsible for making calls to the database using the `mongoengine <https://docs.mongoengine.org/index.html>_`module, which is an ODM (Object-Document Mapper) that allows us to operate with the database more easily.

This object works with the result obtained from the scan in the form of the JSONResult object.

static get_all_networks()[source]#

This method queries the database to obtain the ID and name of all networks.:return: The result of the query is returned :rtype: QuerySet

static get_device_from_address(network_name, address)[source]#

This method retrieves the information of a specific device within a specific network. :param network_name: The name of the network. :type network_name: str :param address: The network address of the device. :type address: str

Returns:

The information of the specific device.

Return type:

nettrackercore.model.model.Device

static get_devices_from_network(network_name)[source]#

This method retrieves all devices within a specific network. :param network_name: The name of the network. :type network_name: str :return: The result of the query is returned. If no devices are found, an empty list is returned. :rtype: BaseList | list

static get_network_from_name(name)[source]#

This method retrieves the information of a specific network by its name. :param name: The name of the network. :type name: str :return: The result of the query is returned. :rtype: Network

insert_device(network_name)[source]#
new_network(name: str, address: str, submask: int)[source]#

This method performs a CRUD operation to create a new record in the database. The data obtained through parameters are defined by the user during the program execution, while the rest should be obtained using the complementary pseudo-private methods. The operation forces the insertion into the database because mongoengine allows the upsert operation. If the operation encounters any errors, they will be subsequently caught in the program.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the network. It must be unique.

  • address (str) – IP address to validate

  • submask (int) – The network mask address in numeric form.

update_network(name: str, address: str, submask: int)[source]#

This method is responsible for updating the database values to the latest ones obtained in the scan. The update operation is atomic, so the entire document and its values will be updated. This way, we always ensure that we have the most up-to-date information possible.

nettrackercore.core.dba module#

class nettrackercore.core.dba.DBA[source]#

Bases: object

The DBA object is responsible for querying the database using NettrackerDAO and displaying the results in table form for the user. Since the database is non-relational, the data shown in the tables is simple. For more complex data such as lists or objects within the model, specific commands are used.

get_devices(network_name)[source]#

This method is responsible for obtaining the list of devices from a specific network and returns them in table form. In this case, it displays the total number of active services, as services are objects within the data model, which is too complex a value for ~rich.table.Table.

Parameters:

network_name (str) – It is the name of the network.

Returns:

A table with the information of the devices.

Return type:

Table

get_network(network_name)[source]#

This method is responsible for obtaining the complete result of a specific network and displaying it in table form. Within the data model, the gateway within a network corresponds to an object, which is too complex a value for ~rich.table.Table, so only the IP address of the device is displayed. Similarly, for the list of devices, only the total number of values in the list is shown. A network name is required to perform the query.

Parameters:

network_name (str) – It is the name of the network.

Returns:

A table with the complete information of a network.

Return type:

Table

get_networks()[source]#

This method returns a table with the result of obtaining all the networks from the database. The displayed data includes: the identifier, the given name, and the network address. This information is necessary to perform other queries.

Returns:

A table with the networks from the database.

Return type:

Table

get_services(network_name, device_address)[source]#

This method is responsible for obtaining the active services of a specific device in a specific network and displays them in table form. It shows the service name, the port number, and the protocol it is working on.

Parameters:

  • network_name (str) – It is the name of the network.

  • device_address (str) – es la dirección IP del dispositivo

Returns:

A table with the information of the services.

Return type:

Table

This exception is thrown when the IP address entered by the user is not valid.

This exception is thrown when the ports entered by the user are not valid.

Bases: Exception

nettrackercore.core.parsers module#

class nettrackercore.core.parsers.NmapParser[source]#

Bases: object

NmapParser is responsible for formatting the parameters entered by the user and returning them as a list.

static create_command(targets=None, ports=None, params=None, sudo=False, temp_file=None) → list | str[source]#

The Popen object requires the arguments it will subsequently execute in list format.

This method is responsible for creating such a list after validating allthe parameters entered by the user. Additionally, the execution resultshould be stored in an XML file, so the -oX parameter is set by default.

If the program is intended to be used from a Windows operating system, the command returned will be a complete string. However, if the program runs from a UNIX/Linux system, the command will be converted into a list with the necessary arguments.

Parameters:

  • targets (str) – User-entered IP addresses.

  • ports (str) – They are the ports entered by the user.

  • params (str) – These are the optional parameters entered by the user.

  • sudo (bool) – Option chosen by the user to execute the command with privileges or not.

  • temp_file (str) – Absolute path of the temporary file where the result will be stored inXML format.

Returns:

The list of the complete command that will be executed with subprocess.

Return type:

list[str]

static parse_params(params)[source]#

This method is responsible for returning the optional parameters entered by the user formatted as a list.

Parameters:

params (str) – Optional parameters entered by the user.

Raises:

IllegalArgumentException –

Returns:

List of optional parameters entered by the user.

Return type:

list[str]

Returns:

static parse_targets(targets)[source]#

This method is responsible for returning the correctly validated addresses. If they are not valid, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:

targets (str) – IP address entered by the user.

Raises:

InvalidAddressException –

Returns:

Validated IP addresses

Return type:

str

static ports_to_list(ports)[source]#

Due to how Nmap works, it’s possible to set ports with commas (,) or hyphens (-) to establish ranges or specific ports.

Parameters:

ports (str) – Ports to validate

Returns:

Ports entered in list format.

Return type:

list

static validate_address(address)[source]#

This method is responsible for validating IP addresses, whether they are network or non-network addresses, using the ipaddress module.

Parameters:

address (str) – IP address to validate

Returns:

True or false depending on the IP address.

Return type:

bool

static validate_ports(port_list)[source]#

This method is responsible for validating the ports entered by the user within a list. If there is any invalid port, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:

port_list (list) – It’s the list of ports to validate.

Raises:

exceptions.InvalidPortsException –

nettrackercore.core.results module#

class nettrackercore.core.results.JSONResult(*args, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: dict

This object encapsulates the result of the scan execution. It inherits the dict object and obtains a dictionary through the constructor that updates its value. This dictionary is obtained by reading the XML file with the scan result.

get_address(host)[source]#

It retrieves the value whose key corresponds to address. Additionally, this method takes into account that the scan detects the MAC address of the device. This value is added to the address key and corresponds to a list.

Example#
    {
    ...,
    'address': [{'@addr': <IP>, '@addrtype': 'ipv4'}, {'@addr': <MAC>, '@addrtype': 'mac', '@vendor': vendor}],
    ...
    }
Parameters:

host (dict) – the value corresponding to host.

Returns:

the value corresponding to address.

Return type:

str

get_host()[source]#

It retrieves the value whose key corresponds to host.

Returns:

the value corresponding to host.

get_hostname(host)[source]#

This method retrieves the hostname.

Parameters:

host (dict) – the value corresponding to host.

Returns:

el valor que corresponde a hostname.

Return type:

str

get_items()[source]#

It retrieves all key-value pairs from the JSONResult object.

Returns:

List with all key-value pairs of the object.

Return type:

list

get_keys()[source]#

It retrieves all keys of the JSONResult object.

Returns:

List with all keys of the object.

Return type:

list

get_os(host)[source]#

This method retrieves the value of the key corresponding to os within host. This value, in turn, contains more information that is not relevant for the program’s logic, so the final data corresponds to osmatch.

Similarly to addresses, it’s possible for the scan to detect multiple operating systems on a single machine; these are displayed as a list with their information. The Nmap scanner, upon finding multiple operating systems, indicates a percentage of accuracy; this percentage indicates how confident it is in that scan. The first value is always the highest (the most reliable), so if the value is a list, the first value in the list is always chosen.

It’s also possible for the scanner not to be able to detect a valid operating system. In these cases, the value of osmatch corresponds to None or Null in other languages. If we obtain a null value and we want to work with it, a TypeError <https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#TypeError>_ exception will be raised, and in that case, a string indicating that a valid operating system could not be found will be returned.

Parameters:

host (dict) – the value corresponding to host.

Returns:

the value corresponding to osmatch.

Return type:

str

get_services(host)[source]#

This method is responsible for obtaining the values corresponding to the open ports and the services running on them. It returns a list of dictionaries where the syntax is as follows:

Syntax of these open ports#
    {"name": nombre, "port":puerto, "protocol": protocolo}
Parameters:

host (dict) – the value corresponding to host.

Returns:

List of dictionaries with the values of the services corresponding to the open ports.

Return type:

list

get_values()[source]#

It retrieves all values from the JSONResult object.

Returns:

List with all the values of the object

Return type:

list

nettrackercore.core.scanner module#

class nettrackercore.core.scanner.Logger[source]#

Bases: object

The Logger class is responsible for writing messages to designated files. There are two files: one for regular logs and another for errors. These files are created beforehand.

static error(config, message)[source]#

This method is responsible for writing error messages to a log. When an error has occurred or an exception has been raised, the trace of that error or the standard error output of a process is saved in the log. The date is also stored in this format.

static log(config, message, command)[source]#

This method is responsible for writing a specific message to the log. To add more information, the current date at the time of program execution is also written.

Parameters:

  • config – Program configuration

  • message – Message to be written inside the log.

  • command – Command launched by the subprocess.

class nettrackercore.core.scanner.Scanner(config)[source]#

Bases: object

Object representing a scanner. This scanner is responsible for using the Nmap package previously installed on the machine. The user sets certain parameters that will later be used by the Nmap package. These parameters are:

  • targets: it can be a network address in CIDR format, an address, or multiple IP addresses, etc.

  • ports: it’s a parameter that sets the ports to be scanned; if nothing is set, all ports are scanned.

The ports format is:

  • 80 -> Only scans the port 80

  • 80,443 -> Only the 80 and 443 ports are scanned

  • 1-1024 -> Only ports between 1 and 1024 are scanned.

  • params: Other Nmap parameters

cleanup()[source]#

This method is responsible for deleting the temporary file necessary for the program’s logic.

execute_command(command)[source]#

This method is responsible for creating a subprocess and executing the command configured by the user. The standard output and error output are obtained using a pipe; the return code is also obtained.

Parameters:

command (list) – The command configured by the user in the form of a list.

Returns:

The standard output, the error output, and the return code.

Return type:

tuple

scan(targets=None, ports=None, params=None, sudo=False)[source]#

The scan method performs the scanning on the assigned targets using the Nmap package. The standard output of the command is stored in a log file, and the scanning result is encapsulated in a JSONResult object.

Parameters:

  • targets (str) – It is the IP address to be scanned. It can be a network address or a host address.

  • ports (str) – These are the ports to be scanned. The ports must be between 1 and 65535, both inclusive.

  • params (str) – These are optional parameters entered by the user and accepted by Nmap.

  • sudo (bool) – Certain parameters require superuser permissions to execute.

Returns:

The scanning result is encapsulated in a JSONResult object.

Return type:

JSONResult
